parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
